intro: Chirita liguliformis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed chirita, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in greenhouses and botanical gardens.
